alert.note: Alert for Faulkner; Pope; Searcy; Van Buren (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 02 at 11:01PM CST until March 03 at 5:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Faulkner County in central Arkansas... Northeastern Pope County in central Arkansas... Southeastern Searcy County in north central Arkansas... Van Buren County in north central Arkansas... * Until 500 AM CST. * At 1101 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clinton, Fairfield Bay, Marshall, Greenbrier, Wooster, Guy, Hector, Damascus, Twin Groves, Shirley, Claude, Choctaw, Rocky Hill, Woolum, Whipple, Old Lexington, Elba, Dabney, Kay and Watts. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
